main event: A military pilot sighted an elongated, cigar-shaped object in the sky over Albuquerque, New Mexico on December 27, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 10-15 seconds,The object exhibited no visible trails and was not identified as a meteor despite its speed, Total visibility of the object was from clear skies with broken high clouds, The witness described the object as the size of a medium transport plane and moving at a high speed of approximately 1,500 to 2,000 miles per hour, The observation was reported to the U.S. Air Force for further investigation.
witness description: A military pilot at Albuquerque airport.
